author: alexmillereth
content:
Looking at `BLSToExecutionChange` and wondering the following:

1. I am assuming the fork info used to build the `Domain`  must now contain `version=0x03000000`, but what about `validators_root`? Will that need to be changed to the actual root at the fork epoch, at which point the spec document will be updated?
2. I'm assuming the output of this operation is the `hash_tree_root` of `SignedBLSToExecutionChange`  -- is that correct? Is there a good resource to figure out what data actually needs to get broadcast to the CL node in order for this operation to be processed by the network?

author: ralexstokes
content: you have to broadcast the full signed message: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/capella/beacon-chain.md#signedblstoexecutionchange

author: alexmillereth
content: Thanks! Just to confirm, you are saying one would simply broadcast the serialized ssz object to a CL node? I'm actually not familiar with the structure/metadata of a CL message

author: ralexstokes
content: you'd most like use this endpoint (or some tool helping you would call it) : https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/?urls.primaryName=dev#/Beacon/submitPoolBLSToExecutionChange
